data.title: A Timeline of Tom Hanks and His Wife Rita Wilsonâ€™s Romance
data.meta_description: Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson have been married since 1988. Here's how Hollywood's most enduring couple overcame cancer and life in the spotlight together.
data.text:
Rita Wilson and Tom Hanks have shared more sweet moments in their 30 plus year marriage than what you'd find in any rom-com.

The 63-year-old actors make up one of the industry's most beloved couples, and have been on more red carpet dates than we can count. Their latest? They appeared at the 77th annual Golden Globe Awards, where Hanks received the honorary Cecil B. DeMille Award for his monumental contributions to entertainment. During his acceptance speech, Hanks teared up while thanking his family.

And as many stars in Tinseltown, their love story began on the set of the ABC TV series, , in the '80s. In honor of the power coupleâ€™s relationship and their ability to overcome even the toughest of times, hereâ€™s a look at the enduring love story of Hanks and Wilson.

1972: Hanks first developed a crush on Wilson when he saw her on The Brady Bunch.

In the early '70s, Wilson made her acting debut as cheerleader Pat Conway on the family sitcom, . Apparently, her pom-pom skills caught the eye of then 16-year-old Hanks.

"I was actually at a friend of mineâ€™s house when it aired and I remember thinking 'that girlâ€™s cute," Hanks shared with reporters at the 2016 New York City premiere of , which the couple produced together. But Hanks didn't act on his feelings until the mid-1980s.

1981: Hanks and Wilson actually met on the set of Bosom Buddies.

Hanks first laid eyes on his future wife-to-be from the comfort of his friend's couch. But in 1981, he finally got the chance to meet Wilson in person while filming the ABC comedy, , that he starred in for two seasons. Wilson appeared as a guest on an episode about a video dating service, and Hanks immediately felt a connection, according to People.

"Rita and I just looked at each other andâ€”kaboingâ€”that was that," he said. "I asked Rita if it was the real thing for her, and it just couldn't be denied."

1985: Hanks and Wilson starred in their first movie together.

As fate would have it, Hanks and Wilson would find themselves paired together in the 1985 comedy, . Proving that his nice guy act carries off-screen as well, Hanks had nothing but complimentary things to say about Wilson after filming the movie.

"When we first looked at each other there was definitely a kind of like, 'Hey, this is the place!' I felt that, anyway," Hanks told Entertainment Tonight in 2015. "I think the end result is that we got married for all the right reasons."

Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson in Volunteers.

However, the actors didn't take their chemistry off-screen, choosing to remain friends instead. At the time, Hanks was still married to his college sweetheart, Samantha Lewes. She passed away in 2002 of bone cancer. Hanks and his late ex-wife had two children together before divorcing in 1987, actor Colin Hanks, 41, and Elizabeth Hanks, 34, who is also an actress and former Huffington Post editor.

December 1986: Hanks and Wilson went public with their relationship.

After working together on , the two lovebirds made their debut as a couple at the Three Amigos premiere. While Hanks was still legally married to Lewes, they were separated.

"I was looking for something I had not found as a kid," Hanks reportedly told the UK Express. "And a broken marriage meant I was sentencing my own kids to the sort of feelings I had at their age. I was just too young and insecure for marriage. I was 23 and my son Colin was already two when I married for the first time. I was not really ready to take on those responsibilities."

At the time of their separation, Colin was 7 and Elizabeth was 3. Hanks and Lewes's divorce was finalized in 1987.

April 1988: Wilson and Hanks get their wedding.

On April 30, 1988, the happy couple tied the knot. Nearly 30 years later, they're still in love and supportive of each other, both in front of the camera and off-screen.

"The success of our relationship was a matter of timing, maturity, and our willingness to have an intimate connection," Hanks told his friend Oprah in 2001. "When I married Rita, I thought, 'This is going to require some change on my part.'"

Hanks continued: "I won't deny that providence was part of us finding each other, but our relationship isn't magicâ€”the way it's shown in movies. In real life, our connection is as concrete as me sitting here. Not that marriage doesn't come close to being hell in a handbasket sometimes. But we both know that no matter what, we'll be with each otherâ€”and we'll get through it."

Little did he know, exactly 14 years later from his interview with Oprah, he and his wife would face their biggest hurdle yet, when Wilson was diagnosed with breast cancer in 2015.

March 1989: The newlyweds attended their first Oscars ceremony together.

Fresh off the heels of their "I do's," the couple walked the red carpet at the 1989 Academy Awards. Hanks was nominated for his performance in the feel-good, body-swap film, . And right by his side was Wilson. Just two months before, in January 1989, Hanks gushed over his wife at the Golden Globes, while accepting the trophy for Actor in a Musical or Comedy for .

"I married a Greek babe," he started his speech. "She was born right here in California, right here in Hollywood, but her folks are great, she's marvelous, Rita Wilsonâ€”thank you, babe, for marrying me. You made my year already, but thank you, Hollywood Foreign Press."

August 1990: Hanks and Wilson welcome their first child.

On August 4, 1990, Hanks and Wilson welcomed their son, Chester "Chet" Marlon Hanks, into the world. The 28-year-old has followed in both his mother and father's footsteps. He's a regular on popular TV shows, such as , , and .

He also starred in , alongside his parents and their friend, Julia Roberts. In addition, Chet inherited the music gene from his mother, who just released her fourth studio album, . He's recorded rap songs, like " " (2018) and " " (2018), under the moniker, "Chet Haze"

June 1993: The husband-and-wife duo are featured in the rom-com, .

In the Nora Ephron-directed love story, starring Hanks and Meg Ryan, Wilson and Hanks played siblings instead of lovers. The film was the launching pad for his career ascension, and is primarily one of the reasons why he's revered as the "nicest guy in Hollywood." According to an article Hanks wrote for TIME in remembrance of Ephron, it was his wife who initially introduced him to Nephron's work, when she took him on a date to see Ephron's movie, .

March 1994: Hanks dedicated his Oscar win to his wife.

Before taking the stage to accept his Best Actor gold statuette for his role in Philadelphia on March 21, 1994, the first thing Hanks did was kiss his wife.

"Here's what I know," he said during the speech. "I could not be standing here without that undying love that was just sung about by, not Bruce Springsteen, but Neil Young. And I have that in a lover that is so close to fine we should all be able to experience such heaven right here on earth."

March 1995: Hanks credited his wife for his standout performance in Forrest Gump.

On March 27, 1995, Hanks became the second actor ever in history to win back-to-back Oscars. This time for the titular role in . As he did the previous year, Hanks expressed sincere gratitude for his wife.

"I am standing here because the woman I share my life with has taught me and demonstrates for me every day just what love is," Hanks said in his speech.

A few years later in 2001, Hanks said in the September 2001 issue of O, The Oprah Magazine that he viewed Wilson as his "lover."

We have a bond that goes beyond words like wife or girlfriend or mother," he said. "Without my connection with Rita, I don't know how I would've been able to connect with what Forrest was going through."

Hanks added: "I said that I have a woman who teaches me what love is everyday. Maybe that sentiment is possible to fake, but for me it's really true. What makes me different from others is that I verbalize this stuff. A lot of people would flee from what they think is award-show cheesiness, and I don't. I often joke that my speeches are very personal moments that play themselves out in front of billions of people."

December 1995: Hanks and Wilson's second child was born.

Hanks would have another reason to celebrate his wife, Wilson, when she birthed their second son, Truman Theodore Hanks, on December 26, 1995. Unlike his parents, older brother, Chet, and his two half-siblings, Colin and Elizabeth, Truman hasn't delved into acting or music yet, preferring to spend his life away from the limelight.

2002: The couple produced their first project together.

Hanks and Wilson co-produced and its 2016 sequel.

"My wife saw an ad back in the day in the LA Times calendar section for a one woman show called and she laughed and said 'Iâ€™m going to go see the show,' and she did," Hanks said at the New York premiere of on March 15, 2016. "She came home and said 'I think thatâ€™s a movie,' and it was," he added.

But the films weren't the only Greek-inspired movies Hanks and Wilson produced as husband and wife. They would later bring the ABBA-themed movie musical, to life on the big screen in 2008, as well as its follow-up in 2018.

September 2004: The family was spotted in a rare public outing.

Wilson tapped into the cheerleading spirit Hanks was initially attracted to at an LA Dodgers baseball game.

"Honestly, I married into a classic old-world family structure in which people like to spend time with each other and construct their lives so they can," Hanks told Oprah in 2001. "In the 13 years Rita and I have been married, I've discovered there's no substitute for that. There's such an advantage to being involved in the day-to-day details of each other's lives. It's a marvelous fabric to exist in."

March 2015: Wilson was diagnosed with breast cancer.

After taking a medical leave of absence from her Broadway run of Fish in the Dark, Wilson revealed her breast cancer diagnosis.

"With my husband by my side, and with the love and support of family and friends, I underwent a bilateral mastectomy and reconstruction for breast cancer after a diagnosis of invasive lobular carcinoma," she told People. "I am recovering and most importantly, expected to make a full recovery. Why? Because I caught this early, have excellent doctors and because I got a second opinion."

The number one person in her corner was, yep, you guessed it, Hanks.

"You never know how your spouse is going to react in a situation like this," she told The New York Times. "I was so amazed, so blown away by the care my husband gave me...who knew it would make you even closer?"

2016: Hanks and Wilson took their love on the road.

While promoting and performing her self-titled album, Rita Wilson, in 2016, Hanks accompanied his wife on her travels.

"We have so much fun," Wilson told E! News in October 2016. "We've gone all over the world. We've taken our family. We've gotten to live in cities that you normally wouldn't get to live in and become a normal person and going to the market and finding your favorite coffee shop. Just pretending that you're a local and that's really great. You don't feel rushed."

April 2018: They celebrated their 30-year anniversary.

Hanks to Instagram to share a quick, but sweet message recognizing he and his wife's milestone anniversary. Along with a photo of the duo standing next to a life-sized cardboard cutout of them on their wedding day, the A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood actor wrote: "30 years on April 30. â€˜88 To â€˜18. Magic numbers. Hanx and @RitaWilson."

March 2019: Hanks supported his wife at the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

Reversing the roles, Hanks was actually the cheerleader for his wife on March 29, when she was honored with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. Hanks, who received his own star in 1992, gave the rundown of his wife's accomplishments as an actress and singer-songwriter. He also mentioned how she has "pitch-perfect taste."

"The lesson here is that Rita Wilson knows what she is doing," Hanks said. "Her instincts are wicked sharp," adding, "so we all know how warranted it is that Rita Wilson be immortalized here with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame."

Positioned just four stars away from her husband's on the south side of the famed boulevard, Hanks and Wilson's love story is now forever immortalized in entertainment history.

April 2019: Hanks cheered on his wife at the Stagecoach country music festival.

Among the 75,000-plus festival attendees in Indio, California, there was one standout fan watching Wilson's electrifying performance: her husband. According to People, Hanks, along with the couple's two children, Chet and Truman, were in the crowd to support Wilson's first appearance at Stagecoach.

Wearing a western-inspired, custom-made Tom Ford design, Wilson performed some of her biggest hits and recent songs from her new album, Halfway to Home.

November 2019: Hanks reveals that Mister Rogers helped strengthen his marriage with Wilson.

It may seem like a strange notion at first, but seeing as the A-lister played the beloved host of Mister Roger's Neighborhood in 2019's critically acclaimed biopic, A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood, Hanks's revelation isn't too far-fetched.

"When my wife and I are going at it on those rare occasions, when she is letting me know that I'm not really listening to her and I'm trying to establish what the ground rules are when we're going at it like that, one of us will say, 'Well, you know what? You know what, honey? It's good to talk," he told Entertainment Tonight. "It's good to say the things we feel. And I learned that from Mister Rogers."

2020: Hanks tears up while thanking his family during an acceptance speech.

Let's set the scene. Hanks was called to the stage to accept his Cecil B. DeMille award, given to people for "outstanding contributions to the world of entertainment." Not long after starting his speech, he had to stop. He was tearing up at the very idea of thanking his wife and children.

Still, he managed to make it through the speech. "These are the people I am most blessed by in this life. I can't tell you how much your love means to me," Hanks said.
